meanings.definition: Any of the bones or segments composing the spinal column, consisting typically of a cylindrical body and an arch with various processes, and forming a foramen, or opening, through which the spinal cord passes.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the vertebras on the X-ray to show where the injury occurred.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sharp pain in her back, right where her vertebras were located.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy chewed on the bone-shaped toy, pretending it was a vertebras.
meanings.sent4: The skyscrapers in the city skyline stood tall and straight like stacked vertebras.
meanings.sent5: The necklace of pearls draped elegantly around her neck, resembling a string of tiny vertebras.
